p: We orally exposed wild-type Ae. aegypti mosquitoes to a standardized infectious dose of eight DENV type 1 isolates derived from human sera sampled in various endemic areas worldwide during 2010â€“2013 ( Table 1). The eight DENV type 1 isolates were genetically diverse and included six isolates belonging to genotype I, and two isolates belonging to genotype V ( Fig 1). Mosquitoes were collected 4, 6, 8, 12 and 18 days after virus oral exposure and assayed for DENV midgut and/or systemic infection. For each isolate, the mean number of mosquitoes assayed per time point was 25 and ranged from 10 to 32.
